etymologies: early 16th century; earliest use found in William Harrington (d. 1523), Catholic priest and author. From cousin + -ry

definitions: The fact or condition of being a cousin; the relation of one cousin to another, or the relationship between cousins.

notes.text: Apparently not recorded in the 17th and 18th centuries.

definitions: A body of cousins; an extended family group. Also (with plural or singular agreement): cousins collectively.
